results.title: Summer of Sam
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, Jon Kilik, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Touchstone
results.brief_description: Set in New York City in the summer of 1977, “Summer of Sam” examines the effects of a massive heatwave on the city as well as the paranoia and fear created by the random serial murders committed by a psychopath who only signed himself, Son of Sam. But though the serial killer plot sets the film in motion, “Summer of Sam” is about much much more, for it is in 1977 when the emerging anarchism of the punk movement collided with the hedonism of the disco era. The hunt for the Son of Sam is merged with the story of two couples: Vinny (John Leguizamo) and Diona (Mira Sorvino), a married Italo-American couple whose relationship is threatened by Vinny’s guilt-stricken affairs; and Ritchie (Aidrien Brody) and Gloria (Jennifer Esposito), two outcasts - he because he refuses to fit the macho stereotypes of the Italian culture, she because of her “slutty” past - who both find acceptance in the growing punk scene of downtown New York. By focussing his camera on the world of working-class Italo-Americans, Spike Lee is not abandoning his commitment to examining American racism. Instead, by accurately representing a segment of the white world in a specific historic and cultural moment, Lee reveals the underlying racism, misogyny and narrow-mindedness of American mass culture. Being a Spike Lee joint, the film is also a wonderful celebration of music, both disco and punk, as well as a sophisticated examination of love and marriage, and bisexuality. Fast-paced, with excellent art design and a superb score, “Summer of Sam” emerges as a bittersweet love poem to the city of New York: its clubs and its porn theatres, its residents black and white, its uptown charms and its downtown sleaze. A contender for the most underrated film of recent times.

results.title: Summer City
results.creator_credit: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1960’s, four young men take off for a weekend fling in search of girls, surf, and thrills, but encounter fear and death. Stars Mel Gibson, Steve Bisley, John Jarratt and Abigail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions

results.title: Stroszek
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Bruno Stroszek is a contemporary equivalent of Kaspar Hauser. The story was actually inspired by the life of Bruno S. who plays Stroszek. Bruno and his two friends form an oddly assorted trio who escape from Berlin’s low-life to Wisconsin in search of an ‘American dream’ which quickly turns sour. What begins as a low-life melodrama with a realistic edge becomes an absurdist road movie then a metaphysical quest. Bruno’s isolation is lent an underlying perverse logic by Herzog’s favourite circle motif recalling Bruno’s early remark that ‘it (life) all goes round in circles’. Cast includes Bruno S., Eva Mattes, Clemens Scheitz. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Stromboli
results.creator_credit: Roberto Rossellini and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman plays Karin, a World War II refugee who marries and Italian fisherman to escape a displaced persons camp. As they set off for his home, the Meditteranean island of Stromboli, her head is filled with romantic notions of an idyllic paradise. When they arrive, however, her dreams are immediately shattered as she is faced with a desolate, barren landscape and the dominating presence of a threatening volcano. The atmosphere from other women in the village also adds to her depression, as they make it clear that her immodesty disgusts them. Filled with unforgettable images and a fishing scene that ranks as one of cinema’s greatest.

results.title: Stranger than paradise
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Sara Driver and Cinesthesia Productions
results.brief_description: Jim Jarmusch’s debut feature is a dead pan masterpiece, utilising to great effect its low key performances, static camera movement and grungy, sparse locations. Shot in high contrast black and white by Tom Decillo (who went on to direct ‘Johnny Suede’ and ‘Living in Oblivion’), this quirky road movie presents a unique outsiders view of America and the characters that inhabit its fringes. Structured as a series of three vignettes spaning New York, Cleveland and Florida, ‘Stranger than Paradise’ stars John Lurie (who also wrote the music) as Wille, a laidback hipster whose meandering lifestyle is briefly disrupted when his Hungarian, teenage cousin (Eszter Balint) comes to stay. The films cool, episodic style, slipping casually between melancholy and off the wall humour became a distinct Jarmusch trade mark, fine tuned in later films such as ‘Down by law’, ‘Mystery Train’, ‘Night on earth’ and ‘Dead man’. Cast also includes Richard Edson. (Awards: Winner of the Cannes 1984 Camera d’Or for Best First Feature)

results.title: Stir
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Smiley Films, New South Wales Film Corporation and Stephen Wallace
results.brief_description: A tense, realistic Australian drama which examines the barbarity and cruelty that exists within an Australian jail for male prisoners. Bryan Brown stars as a young but experienced convict determined to protest against the mindless, and often dehumanising, rules and limitations placed on prisoners. The script-writer, Bob Jewson, was a prisoner at Bathurst Goal in 1974 and he has based his script for “Stir” on the events and personalities which led to the infamous rioting at that institution. “Stir” culminates in a similar explosive finish. Cast also includes Max Phipps, Dennis Miller, Gary Waddell, Phil Motherwell, Edward Robshaw, Michael Gow and Robert ‘Tex’ Morton. Written by Bob Jewson. Photography by Geoff Burton.

results.title: Stickmen
results.creator_credit: Hamish Rothwell, Michelle Turner, Film 2, New Zealand On Air, New Zealand Film Commission and Stickfilms
results.brief_description: Sticks, or pool, means more than life to Jack (Robbie Magasiva), Wayne (Scott Wills) and Thomas (Paolo Rotondo) - it can even override sex. In fact, “pub pool is the perfect game…conflict, drama, thrill of the chase, strategy and a cliff-hanger ending”. What more could you want? As best mates, the trio spend most of their spare time hustling at Dave’s Bar for a bit of a laugh and some money on the side until one night they are asked to enter into a high stakes tournament run by the local crime boss “Daddy” (Enrico Mammarella). Their pool-playing lives suddenly changes - as the stakes get higher so trouble seems to follow and all three are faced with the prospect of doing what Daddy asks or else! But more than anything else, the “Stickmen” want to win. Humor, sex, violence, romance and pool blend together to make this a quirky and upbeat film in the tradition of “Lock stock and two smoking barrels” and also is director Hamish Rothwell’s first feature film. Cast includes Anne Nordhaus, Simone Xessell, John Leigh, Kirk Torrance, Luanne Gordon.

results.title: Steamboat Willie
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Steamboat Willie is the first animated film to use synchronised sound, and the first Mickey Mouse cartoon ever released. Mickey appears as a crew member on a riverboat which is captained by big bad Pete. Minnie Mouse is the passenger who joins Mickey as he uses various props as musical instruments. Animation by Ub Iwerks.

results.title: Steamboat Bill Jr. (Musical Soundtrack)
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton Productions and Charles Reisner
results.brief_description:
Set in the Deep South with Keaton as the wimpish son of a steamboat captain who ultimately proves himself in helping his father fight off a wealthy rival. Particularly memorable is the hat-buying sequence and the remarkably staged cyclone sequence in which the town is destroyed around a stoic Buster. Version without musical soundtrack also available on 16mm.

Credits: Director, Chas F. Reisner ; photographers, Dev Jennings, Bert Haines ; writers, Carl Harbaugh, Buster Keaton ; piano accompaniment, William Perry.
Cast: Buster Keaton, Tom McGuire, Ernest Torrence, Tom Lewis, Marion Byron.

results.title: Starman
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An alien (Jeff Bridges) makes a stopover on earth when he encounters the Voyager 2 probe. By masquerading as a human he has the opportunity, if only for a little while, to live like an ordinary man. His arrival is quickly discovered by a young woman (Karen Allen) who develops feelings for the Starman and agrees to assist him in the 2000 mile journey it will take him to get home. Cast includes Charles Martin Smith and Richard Jaeckel.
